title: Art Deco throwback blah.
content:
I need to find out what this typeface is. Definitely not my personal favorite.

It’s similar to Casablanca, Anna, or Blakely ... but not quite.

Please help! Thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [parts.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201171235/http:/typophile.com/files/parts.jpg) | 34.51 KB |

 [‹ Nirvana Nirvana](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201171235/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46083 "Go to previous forum topic") [Know this font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201171235/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45920 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Gemma Bayly

comments.content:
It seems to match the old Image Club [“Arquitectura”](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201171235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/arquitectura/), which is very close to the [Casablanca Condensed Alternate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201171235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/casablanca-rr/casablanca-rrcond-alt-light/). The main differences are the top of the A, and the extensions to the left of the stem, which are angled, like your sample.

- Mike Yanega
It’s a stretched version of arquitectura. You’re my hero! Thanks!!!
